definitions.title: adj.
definitions.body: sure, assured (Pers. azda, Skr. addhâ, ‘certain’ (Kern:ZDMG 1869, 220); so first Nö KAT 2 617; confirmed now by Eg. Aram. (RÉS:361, B 3) [[הן אזד]] [[יחעבד מן]] if it is made certain (certified) by, etc.; > LXX Ki AV al. (v. Thea) as vb. is gone, or ([[אָֽזְדָא]]) is going, from Talm. [[אֲזַד]] (= [[אֲזַל]]) go away (Levy:NHWB i. 50); so Scheft:MGWJ 1903, 310 from Zend * azda ‘gone,’ ptcp. pass. of azaiti ‘go’);—Da 2:5 [[מִלְּתָה]] [[מִנִּי אַוְדָּא]], v:Da 2:8 [[דִּי־אַזְדָּא מִנִּי מִלְּתָא]] the word is assured on my part (the thing is fully resolved upon by me: cf. Syrver 4ariyro0; IE [[קַיׇּימָא וֶאְמֶת]]); + Da 3:14(v.[[חְדָא]]).
